_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan ? Executive Summary

Farmers Cooperative Association
1204 St. Olaf Ave. N
Canby, MN  45220

For additional information please contact Peter Schmitz.

The Facility Policy:
     Farmers Coop Assn owners, management, and employees are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  Should an accidental release occur, our facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, and other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

Facility Information:
     The primary activities at our facility are the storage of anhydrous ammonia to be resold as nitrogen fertilizer for crop production.  
     Our anhydrous ammonia storage tanks and plant are located 1 mile south of the city of Canby, MN on Hwy 75.
     At this location we have three storage tanks and 47 nurse tanks.  

The Accidental Release Prevention Program:
     This facility has implemented the rules and provisions of Minnesota Code of Agency Rules, ?Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia?, 1513.0010-1513.1100 and all employees handling anhydrous ammonia are trained.

Five-Year Accident History:  
     There has been no accidental release of any anhydrous ammonia in the past 5 years at any of our facilities that has caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuation, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage. 

Emergency Response Plan:
     Our facility has a written emergency response plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38.  We have provided the state and local authorities with the emergency planning and Community Right-to-Know information as required under SARA Title (EPCRA) MN Section 312 Tier II.  We also have an agreement with county law enforcement to monitor the facility for any suspicious activities to help prevent a release from illegal equipment tampe

ring.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
     Safety at Farmers Coop Assn. Facilities is an on-going process, with assessments and evaluations performed periodically by organizations such as SRA to determine unsafe conditions and needed maintenance.  By September of 2009 we will be installing traffic barriers around the storage tanks to prevent collisions which could cause a release.
